summary: This bill, the Medal of Sacrifice Act, establishes a medal to honor law enforcement officers and first responders killed in the line of duty. The President is responsible for issuing the medal. The bill outlines eligibility criteria, including an exception for officers with official findings of wrongdoing. It also mandates the creation of a Commission to advise on the medal's design, promote its establishment, determine presentation methods, and make final eligibility determinations. The Commission will initially award the medal to three specific deputies. The bill includes a detailed description of the medal's design and materials and specifies the Commission's sunset provision.
